page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: MY GRANDMOTHER HAS LIVED IN WEST TANFIELD FOR THE PAST 60yrs AND SHE HAS SEEN MANY CHANGES IN THE VILLAGE IN THAT TIME.SHE STARTED WORK AS MAID AT THE BRUCE INN (SERVING MEALS AND WORKING IN THE KITCHENS AND BEDROOM). TODAY THE BRUCE IS PURELY A PUBLIC HOUSE SERVING DRINKS AND BARMEALS. WHEN GRANDMOTHER WAS A GIRL THE TRANSPORT TO RIPON WAS A HORSE AND WAGONETTE AND THE RAILWAY.IN THE 1920'S A BUS SERVICE BEGAN.IT RAN AT 8am ,1pm AN 5pm EACH DAY;AN EXTRA BUS RAN ON SATURDAYS AND THURSDAY AT 9pm.IN 1985,THERE IS LITTLE PUBLIC TRANSPORT,THE RAILWAY HAS CLOSED,AND BUSES RUN ONLY ONCE ON THURSDAY AND SATURDAY THOUGH WE DO HAVE A POST BUS TWICE A DAY.GRANDMOTHER COULD REMEMBER WHEN THERE WERE MANY SERVICES AT THE LOCAL ST.NICHOLA'S CHURCH EACH SUNDAY. THERE WERE 3 SERVICES,NOW THERE IS 1.
